javmos.components.functions

Class Tangent

  • java.lang.Object
    • javmos.components.JavmosComponent
      • javmos.components.functions.Function
        • javmos.components.functions.Trigonometric
          • javmos.components.functions.Tangent

  • public final class Tangent
extends Trigonometric
    This class models the tangent function. You cannot add any other methods nor modify the method signatures.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tangent

        public Tangent(JavmosGUI gui,
               java.lang.String function)
        Class constructor.
        Parameters:
        gui - An instance of the JavmosGUI.
        function - A String representation of the tangent function written in terms of y or f(x). Functions will be written in the form y=atan(kx) where a is the amplitude and k is the horizontal stretch. For Example: y=6tan(5x)

      • getValueAt

        public double getValueAt(double x,
                         FunctionType functionType)
        This method returns the value of the tangent function defined by the parameter functionType.
        Specified by:
        getValueAt in class Function
        Parameters:
        x - The x value at which the tangent function is being evaluated at.
        functionType - An enum that determines the type of value being calculated.
        Returns:
        Returns the f(x) value of the tangent function specified by functionType.

      • getCriticalPoints

        public java.util.HashSet<Point> getCriticalPoints()
        This method returns a HashSet of all the critical points belonging to the tangent function.
        Overrides:
        getCriticalPoints in class Function
        Returns:
        Returns an empty HashSet as tangent functions do not have critical points.

      • getInflectionPoints

        public java.util.HashSet<Point> getInflectionPoints()
        This method returns a HashSet of all the inflection points belonging to the tangent function.
        Overrides:
        getInflectionPoints in class Function
        Returns:
        Returns an empty HashSet as tangent functions do not have inflection points.
